com.tcss543.networkflow

Class PreFlowPush

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tcss543.networkflow.PreFlowPush

  • public class PreFlowPush
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implement Preflow-push Algorithm and returns the maximum flow. The getMaxFlow() method will return the max flow of a given graph. It will return -1 if there is no start node or sink node in the input graph. It will return -2 if there are some edges with negative capacity.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pai Zhang

        public PreFlowPush()

    • Method Detail

      • intializeGraph

        private void intializeGraph(com.tcss543.graphcode.SimpleGraph sg)
        Initialize the input graph
        Parameters:
        sg - The input SimpleGraph

      • checkGraph

        private int checkGraph()
        Checks the validity input graph.
        Returns:
        0 if the graph is validate, -1 if there is no start node or sink node in the graph and -2 if there are some edges with negative capacity

      • initializeHeights

        private void initializeHeights()
        Initializes the heights of vertices. The height of the s node is equal to the number of vertex in the graph. The heights of other nodes are equal to zero.

      • initializeFlow

        private void initializeFlow()
        Initialize the starting flow. The flow of edges which start from s node are assigned a value equal to the capacities of the edges. The flow of other edges are assigned a zero value.

      • showFlowStatus

        private void showFlowStatus()
        Prints out the status of flow of all edges

      • findExcessNode

        private com.tcss543.graphcode.Vertex findExcessNode()
        Finds a node with excess flow value greater than zero.
        Returns:
        vertex v if there exists a node with positive excess value null if there is no node with positive excess value

      • updateExcess

        private void updateExcess()
        Update the excess status of each vertex. This method gets called when the flow changes.

      • push

        private boolean push(com.tcss543.graphcode.Edge e,
                     com.tcss543.graphcode.Vertex v)
        Pushes an flow along the edge if it is possible. It increases the flow of the edge if it's a forward edge and decreases the flow if it's a backward edge.
        Parameters:
        e - An edge along which flow needs to be pushed.
        v - The vertex which has positive excess flow value.
        Returns:
        true if the edge is applicable for pushing the flow other wise false.

      • relabel

        private void relabel(com.tcss543.graphcode.Vertex v)
        Re-label the height of vertex if it is applicable
        Parameters:
        v - the vertex which needs be relabeled

      • getMaxFlow

        public double getMaxFlow(com.tcss543.graphcode.SimpleGraph sg)
        Finds the max flow in the graph. It will return the max flow of a given graph according to the Preflow-push Algorithm.
        Parameters:
        sg - the input SimpleGraph
        Returns:
        the max flow of the given input graph, -1 if there is no s node or t node in the graph, and -2 if there exists some edges with negative capacities
